author: legomaniac
title: Yo I heard you like LEGO bricks, so I got a brick to store bricks, and stacks like a brick :D
review:
I've been wanting to get one of these storage bricks for a long time. Now I have one and im impressed. I knew 19 inches is big for a storage container, but once it came in, I was blown away. Big shiny blue brick that the top comes off to store...well LEGO bricks.

$41.99 is a hefty price to pay for a storage bin. I was able to get it at $33. For what you pay you get a huge storage bin, looks like your favorite product, great decoration instead of those tupperware containers we use, quality made, and paying for the brand of course. Made by a company called Plast Team in Denmark, made in Poland...not China. Which might add to why its expensive, but it's worth it.

Pros

  • Same exact colors that LEGO uses
  • Made in Poland, not China
  • HUGE
  • Well made, even the bottom looks just like a 2x4 brick

Cons

  • Expensive and only 3 avaliable colors, unless you want to try eBay and pay alot.
  • Takes up a lot of room
  • Inside where the 3 round rings that are on the bottom, makes a deep crevice on the inside. I wouldn't store really small parts like 1x1 plates. They might get stuck in there.  Super glue or some kind of filler would work, but im just nit picking :)

Overall it is a fantastic storage brick. $41.99 is a steep price, but it is worth it, especially if you can get it cheaper. Adds a bit of variety other than clear storage containers.
